alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 6:52AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 AM HST, radar indicated moderate to heavy showers persistently developing over windward east Maui, with rain falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Stream gages show rising water levels, and additional showers are expected to develop through at least mid-morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kipahulu, Kaupo, Nahiku, Keanae, Hana, Haleakala National Park, Wailua, and Hamoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1000 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
